title: Tom Hiddleston’s Front Row Fashion at Gucci Fall 2017
text: Tom Hiddleston Shows the Dapper Side of Gucci February 22, 2017 7:19 PM by Janelle Okwodu Photo: Alessandro Garofalo / Indigital.tv It’s easy to think of Alessandro Michele ’s vision for Gucci as being composed solely of whimsical vintage-inspired ensembles, but the pattern-heavy pieces presented on the runway represent only one side of the Gucci look. In the front row at this morning’s Milan show, actor Tom Hiddleston showed the brand’s other perspective in a bespoke suit with a timeless appeal. Sporting navy pinstripes, a bright red tie, and oxfords, Hiddleston looked like a classic gentleman and stood out among all the more outlandish looks. As the face of Gucci’s made-to-order wares, Hiddleston regularly selects dapper custom Gucci for events, and his love of tailored suiting has been a constant throughout his career. Though it seems unlikely that he will be spotted in any of the head-to-toe floral suits featured in today’s collection, his commitment to making a quiet statement with clothing is admirable. Hiddleston’s latest look may even be good enough to make the world forget that regrettable “I Heart T.S.” shirt.
